issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: *Assessment* If the 's3-url' is set to use the IP of the Eucalyptus CLC and Walrus is on a different machine, [euca-upload-bundle|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#euca2ools-guide/euca-upload-bundle.html] receives an error from the CLC, however it displays that all the parts have been uploaded, when in fact they haven't. The bucket is created successfully on Walrus, however the only file uploaded in the manifest file. {code} [root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-bundle-image -i utopic-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw -r x86_64 [com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.WalrusImageManager.logWithContext(WalrusImageManager.java):167] [CorrelationId: af5de4a8-0229-4049-bc4b-09ee2b629647 | Account: 000000000000] Assembling parts for image utopic-server-x86_64-hvm/utopic-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml into file: //var/lib/eucalyptus/bukkits/utopic-server-x86_64-hvm/215582b4-5804-4d58-90be-ca532ccfdffe.crypt.gz Wed May 21 20:20:22 2014 INFO [WalrusImageManager:Bukkit.15] [com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.WalrusImageManager.logWithContext(WalrusImageManager.java):167] [CorrelationId: af5de4a8-0229-4049-bc4b-09ee2b629647 | Account: 000000000000] Assembly of parts complete for image utopic-server-x86_64-hvm/utopic-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml Wed May 21 20:20:22 2014 INFO [WalrusImageManager:Bukkit.15] [com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.WalrusImageManager.logWithContext(WalrusImageManager.java):167] [CorrelationId: af5de4a8-0229-4049-bc4b-09ee2b629647 | Account: 000000000000] Starting decryption for image utopic-server-x86_64-hvm/utopic-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml in file //var/lib/eucalyptus/bukkits/utopic-server-x86_64-hvm/215582b4-5804-4d58-90be-ca532ccfdffe.crypt.gz Wed May 21 20:20:22 2014 ERROR [WalrusImageManager:Bukkit.15] [com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.WalrusImageManager.decryptImage(WalrusImageManager.java):383] javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException: last block incomplete in decryption {code} This was something that I easily ran into when I created an euca2ools configuration file. It was a simple error of putting in the wrong IP for Walrus. CLC is on 10.104.10.55, where as Walrus is located on 10.104.10.11. *Workaround* Set the correct IP for Walrus in the euca2ools configuration file.
fields.summary: euca-upload-bundle fails to handle error response from Walrus if S3_URL is incorrect

comments.body: Created a [KB article|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/202375820] regarding the behavior experienced.

*Update* It seems this happens if the IP is set to any component that is running a Eucalyptus Java component other than Walrus. Below, I tested by setting the IP to the Storage Controller component: {code} [root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-upload-bundle -b utopic-server-wrong-s3-url -m [root@odc-c-11 ~]# file /bukkits/utopic-server-wrong-s3-url/* /bukkits/utopic-server-wrong-s3-url/f20e825e-bb03-4fdc-9dc2-099f416f30af: ASCII text, with very long lines, with no line terminators [root@odc-c-11 ~]# ls -l /bukkits/utopic-server-wrong-s3-url/ total 8 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 7041 May 26 10:45 f20e825e-bb03-4fdc-9dc2-099f416f30af {code}

The bundle's manifest uploads successfully because that file is small enough to be able to finish uploading in time for euca-upload-bundle to get its redirect from the original service.  The bundle's parts, however, are large enough that the service closes the connection before this can happen, leaving euca-upload-bundle with no feedback whatsoever other than a socket error.  There are two problems here:

# euca-upload-bundle does not halt the upload after encountering the first socket error.  I can work on fixing this.
# euca-upload-bundle's back end for PUT requests tries to finish its entire upload before attempting to read the service's response, which is what causes the socket errors in the first place.

The latter is fixable with an {{Expect: 100-continue}} header, but it would effectively require implementing an HTTP client from scratch to handle it due to design limitations in httplib, part of the python standard library and the lowest level of the requestbuilder stack.  Thankfully, changing the endpoint works around this problem.
